title: FTSE LIVE: Pound looks to crunch Brexit vote in Parliament; UK stocks in the red
text:
Stocks got off to a slow start on Friday after the latest GDP data from China reinforced the importance of the country resolving its trade dispute with the US.

Meanwhile, the pound is in wait-and-see mode. After a roller-coaster day on Thursday, the parliamentary vote on Saturday - and avoiding a no-deal Brexit - is all that matters to the currency now.

In company news, haulage firm Wincanton has confirmed it is looking at making an offer to buy rival Eddie Stobart, and Marriott Hotels has snapped up luxury Barbados hotel business Elegant for £101million.
description: Stocks got off to a slow start on Friday after the latest GDP data from China reinforced the importance of the country resolving its trade dispute with the US.
authors: Emily Hardy For This Is Money
